strapiPost.title: Fayetteville Ale Trail Celebrates 10 Years
strapiPost.content:
Launched by Experience Fayetteville in August 2013, the Fayetteville Ale Trail is approaching its tenth birthday as the essential Northwest Arkansas brewery experience and has printed over 35,000 passports so far!

  • Well traveled: Passports can be picked up at the Experience Fayetteville Visitors Center, at any of the 19 breweries on the Ale Trail, or ordered online. Once the passport has been stamped at each location, it can be turned in for a free prize.
  • A taste of the region: The 19 stops along the Fayetteville Ale Trail provide a glimpse into the unique craft brewery and cidery culture of Northwest Arkansas, including stops in Fayetteville, Springdale, Rogers, Bentonville, Lowell, Eureka Springs, and Siloam Springs.

Order your passport and start your Fayetteville Ale Trail journey HERE.
